options.name: -bt
options.description: Set video bitrate tolerance (in bits/s). In 1-pass mode, bitrate tolerance specifies how far ratecontrol is willing to deviate from the target average bitrate value. This is not related to minimum/maximum bitrate. Lowering tolerance too much has an adverse effect on quality. (from 1 to INT_MAX) (default 4000000)

values.description: allow decoders to produce unaligned output
use four motion vectors per macroblock (MPEG-4)
error[?] variables will be set during encoding
Input bitstream might be randomly truncated
place global headers in extradata instead of every keyframe
H.263 advanced intra coding / MPEG-4 AC prediction
Drop frames whose parameters differ from first decoded frame
place global headers at every keyframe instead of in extradata
Frame data might be split into multiple chunks
Show all frames before the first keyframe
export motion vectors through frame side data
do not skip samples and export skip information as frame side data
do not reset ASS ReadOrder field on flush
export motion vectors through frame side data
export Producer Reference Time through packet side data
export video encoding parameters through frame side data
export film grain parameters through frame side data

options.name: -g
options.description: set the group of picture (GOP) size (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 12)

options.name: -ar
options.description: set audio sampling rate (in Hz) (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -ac
options.description: set number of audio channels (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -cutoff
options.description: set cutoff bandwidth (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -qcomp
options.description: video quantizer scale compression (VBR). Constant of ratecontrol equation. Recommended range for default rc_eq: 0.0-1.0 (from -FLT_MAX to FLT_MAX) (default 0.5)

options.name: -qblur
options.description: video quantizer scale blur (VBR) (from -1 to FLT_MAX) (default 0.5)

options.name: -qdiff
options.description: maximum difference between the quantizer scales (VBR) (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 3)

options.name: -bf
options.description: set maximum number of B-frames between non-B-frames (from -1 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -b_qfactor
options.description: QP factor between P- and B-frames (from -FLT_MAX to FLT_MAX) (default 1.25)

options.name: -b_strategy
options.description: strategy to choose between I/P/B-frames (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -ps
options.description: RTP payload size in bytes (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -bug
options.description: work around not autodetected encoder bugs (default autodetect)

values.description: Xvid interlacing bug (autodetected if FOURCC == XVIX)
work around various bugs in Microsoft's broken decoders

options.name: -strict
options.description: how strictly to follow the standards (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default normal)

values.label: very
values.description: strictly conform to a older more strict version of the spec or reference software

values.label: strict
values.description: strictly conform to all the things in the spec no matter what the consequences

options.name: -b_qoffset
options.description: QP offset between P- and B-frames (from -FLT_MAX to FLT_MAX) (default 1.25)

values.description: abort decoding on minor error detection
consider things that violate the spec, are fast to check and have not been seen in the wild as errors
consider all spec non compliancies as errors
consider things that a sane encoder should not do as an error

options.name: -mpeg_quant
options.description: use MPEG quantizers instead of H.263 (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -maxrate
options.description: maximum bitrate (in bits/s). Used for VBV together with bufsize. (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -minrate
options.description: minimum bitrate (in bits/s). Most useful in setting up a CBR encode. It is of little use otherwise. (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -bufsize
options.description: set ratecontrol buffer size (in bits) (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -i_qfactor
options.description: QP factor between P- and I-frames (from -FLT_MAX to FLT_MAX) (default -0.8)

options.name: -i_qoffset
options.description: QP offset between P- and I-frames (from -FLT_MAX to FLT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -lumi_mask
options.description: compresses bright areas stronger than medium ones (from -FLT_MAX to FLT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -dark_mask
options.description: compresses dark areas stronger than medium ones (from -FLT_MAX to FLT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -idct
options.description: select IDCT implementation (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default auto)

values.description: use strong deblock filter for damaged MBs
favor predicting from the previous frame

options.name: -pred
options.description: prediction method (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default left)

options.name: -dia_size
options.description: diamond type & size for motion estimation (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -last_pred
options.description: amount of motion predictors from the previous frame (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -preme
options.description: pre motion estimation (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -pre_dia_size
options.description: diamond type & size for motion estimation pre-pass (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -subq
options.description: sub-pel motion estimation quality (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 8)

options.name: -me_range
options.description: limit motion vectors range (1023 for DivX player) (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -mbd
options.description: macroblock decision algorithm (high quality mode) (from 0 to 2) (default simple)

options.name: -sc_threshold
options.description: scene change threshold (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -rc_init_occupancy
options.description: number of bits which should be loaded into the rc buffer before decoding starts (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -threads
options.description: set the number of threads (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 1)

values.label: auto
values.description: autodetect a suitable number of threads to use

options.name: -skip_top
options.description: number of macroblock rows at the top which are skipped (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -skip_bottom
options.description: number of macroblock rows at the bottom which are skipped (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -skip_threshold

options.name: -skip_factor
options.description: frame skip factor (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -skip_exp
options.description: frame skip exponent (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.description: frame skip compare function (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default dctmax)

values.description: ignore level even if the codec level used is unknown or higher than the maximum supported level reported by the hardware driver

options.name: -obmc

values.description: RD optimal MB level residual skipping
Use rate distortion optimization for qp selection
use rate distortion optimization for CBP

options.name: -luma_elim_threshold
options.description: single coefficient elimination threshold for luminance (negative values also consider dc coefficient) (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -chroma_elim_threshold
options.description: single coefficient elimination threshold for chrominance (negative values also consider dc coefficient) (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -error_rate
options.description: Simulate errors in the bitstream to test error concealment. (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -qsquish
options.description: how to keep quantizer between qmin and qmax (0 = clip, 1 = use differentiable function) (from 0 to 99) (default 0)

options.name: -rc_qmod_freq
options.description: experimental quantizer modulation (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -rc_eq
options.description: Set rate control equation. When computing the expression, besides the standard functions defined in the section 'Expression Evaluation', the following functions are available: bits2qp(bits), qp2bits(qp). Also the following constants are available: iTex pTex tex mv fCode iCount mcVar var isI isP isB avgQP qComp avgIITex avgPITex avgPPTex avgBPTex avgTex.

options.name: -rc_init_cplx

options.name: -pbias
options.description: inter quant bias (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 999999)

options.name: -force_duplicated_matrix
options.description: Always write luma and chroma matrix for mjpeg, useful for rtp streaming. (default false)

options.name: -b_strategy
options.description: Strategy to choose between I/P/B-frames (from 0 to 2) (default 0)

options.name: -b_sensitivity
options.description: Adjust sensitivity of b_frame_strategy 1 (from 1 to INT_MAX) (default 40)

options.name: -brd_scale

options.description: Frame skip factor (from INT_MIN to INT_MAX) (default 0)

Also the following constants are available: iTex pTex tex mv fCode iCount mcVar var isI isP isB avgQP qComp avgIITex avgPITex avgPPTex avgBPTex avgTex.

values.description: reduce the latency by flushing out packets immediately
do not fill in missing values that can be exactly calculated
disable AVParsers, this needs nofillin too
try to interleave outputted packets by dts
reduce the latency introduced by optional buffering
stop muxing with the shortest stream

options.description: microseconds by which audio packets should be interleaved earlier (from 0 to 2.14748e+09) (default 0)

options.name: -chunk_size
options.description: size in bytes for each chunk (from 0 to 2.14748e+09) (default 0)

options.name: -f_err_detect

values.description: abort decoding on minor error detection
consider things that violate the spec, are fast to check and have not been seen in the wild as errors
consider all spec non compliancies as errors
consider things that a sane encoder shouldn't do as an error

options.name: -max_interleave_delta

values.label: strict
values.description: strictly conform to all the things in the spec no matter what the consequences

values.description: Make the initial moov atom empty
Write separate moof/mdat atoms for each track
Create a live smooth streaming feed (for pushing to a publishing point)
Run a second pass to put the index (moov atom) at the beginning of the file
Omit the base data offset in tfhd atoms
Set the default-base-is-moof flag in tfhd atoms
Signal that the next fragment is discontinuous from earlier ones
Delay writing the initial moov until the first fragment is cut, or until the first fragment flush
Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
Write colr atom even if the color info is unspecified (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
If writing colr atom prioritise usage of ICC profile if it exists in stream packet side data
Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)

options.name: -moov_size
options.description: maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

values.description: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing

options.name: -ism_lookahead
options.description: Number of lookahead entries for ISM files (from 0 to 255) (default 0)

options.name: -video_track_timescale
options.description: set timescale of all video tracks (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -fragment_index
options.description: Fragment number of the next fragment (from 1 to INT_MAX) (default 1)

options.name: -mov_gamma
options.description: gamma value for gama atom (from 0 to 10) (default 0)

options.name: -frag_interleave
options.description: Interleave samples within fragments (max number of consecutive samples, lower is tighter interleaving, but with more overhead) (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

options.name: -encryption_scheme
options.description: Configures the encryption scheme, allowed values are none, cenc-aes-ctr

options.name: -use_stream_ids_as_track_ids
options.description: use stream ids as track ids (default false)

options.name: -write_prft

split the hls segment by time which user set by hls_time
append the new segments into old hls segment list
include segment index in segment filenames when use_localtime
include segment duration in segment filenames when use_localtime
include segment size in segment filenames when use_localtime
reload keyinfo file periodically for re-keying

values.description: Make the initial moov atom empty
Write separate moof/mdat atoms for each track
Create a live smooth streaming feed (for pushing to a publishing point)
Run a second pass to put the index (moov atom) at the beginning of the file
Omit the base data offset in tfhd atoms
Set the default-base-is-moof flag in tfhd atoms
Signal that the next fragment is discontinuous from earlier ones
Delay writing the initial moov until the first fragment is cut, or until the first fragment flush
Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
Write colr atom even if the color info is unspecified (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
If writing colr atom prioritise usage of ICC profile if it exists in stream packet side data
Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)

options.name: -moov_size
options.description: maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)

values.description: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
